feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [GRA, RBX, SBG, BHS / France, Canada][ Cisco ASA firewall] – Baremetal – Cisco ASA firewall – Planned Service End of Life
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 31, 10:00 - 11:00 UTC

Dec 6, 12:21 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 28/02/2022 10:00 UTC
Service impact : As part of the product lifecycle management we plan to end the baremetal service of Cisco ASA firewall by August 31, 2022. This service interruption will concern only the customers who have previously subscribed to this service.
OVHcloud will decommission the service so that you won’t be able to connect to your Cisco ASA firewall from that date.
Please make the appropriate backup of your data prior that date.
---------------------------------------------------
Heure de début : 28/02/2022 10:00 UTC
Impact du service : Dans le cadre de la gestion du cycle de vie des produits, nous prévoyons de mettre fin au service baremetal du pare-feu Cisco ASA au 31 aout 2022. Cette interruption de service ne concernera que les clients qui ont précédemment souscrit à ce service.
OVHcloud mettra le service hors service de sorte que vous ne pourrez plus vous connecter à votre pare-feu Cisco ASA à partir de cette date.
Veuillez effectuer les sauvegardes appropriées de vos données avant cette date.

entry.title: [BHS5][Public network] - T05G09 -T05G28 - T05G30 - T05G34 - T05G35 - T05G37 - T05G39 - T05H02 - T05H03 - T05H04 - T05H05 - T05H06 - T05H07 - T05H09 - T05H10 - T05H11 - T05H26 - T05H28
entry.content:
Apr 5, 21:38 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 05/04/2022 13:41 UTC
End Time : 05/04/2022 18:32 UTC
Service impact : All the IPs are now operational. . The switches are working as expected at this time. We will continue to monitor the situation for another 3 hours.
Root cause : There was a VPC (virtual port channel) issue between the switches A and B

Apr 5, 19:12 UTC
Update - Start Time : 05/04/2022 13:41 UTC
End Time : 05/04/2022 18:32 UTC
Service impact : All the IPs are now operational. . The switches are working as expected at this time. We will continue to monitor the situation for another 3 hours.
Root cause : There was a VPC (virtual port channel) issue between the switches A and B

Apr 5, 18:34 UTC
Update - Actually, for the 2 switches A and B, 2535 out of 2604 IPs are operational.

Apr 5, 18:27 UTC
Update - The services were interrupted again between 18h00 utc and 18h14. switch B is operational again. we are going to carry out manual operations on switch A

Apr 5, 17:46 UTC
Monitoring - We have observed a loss of public network between 16h12 UTC and 16h43 UTC. All services are now functional. We are investigating the situation with the hardware manufacturer. We will update this status as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience caused

Apr 5, 16:47 UTC
Update - Update :The situation on switch B is improving. We are more than 90% recovered on this switch

Apr 5, 16:37 UTC
Update - Update :The switch B became unreachable too, all the servers are now unreachable.

Apr 5, 15:44 UTC
Update - Update : These racks were on a switch A wich became unreachable, the switch B took over for all the communications. The switch A is going to be restarted.

Apr 5, 15:17 UTC
Update - Service impact :The public network may be shortly unreachable and latency may increase slightly.

Apr 5, 15:01 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 05/04/2022 13:41UTC
Service impact : 18 racks have become unstable. However, they are all redundant.
Ongoing actions : Our technicians are currently working on

Apr 3, 22:01 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 18, 01:09 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 03/04/2022 22:00 UTC
End time : 06/04/2022 04:00 UTC
Service impact : Servers will be unreachable during operations (30 minutes per server).
Service improvement : Following the failure of an altigo (power supply and server reboot equipment) for which we have no spare, we have to relocate the servers to a compatible rack.

entry.title: [RBX2][vRack] - Switch unavailable
entry.content:
Apr 3, 19:29 UTC
Resolved - We close the incident, the instabilities have been corrected

Apr 3, 17:45 UTC
Monitoring - Update : The update has been successfully completed. No impact at this time.

We are keeping the ticket on monitoring to confirm that the update fixes the instabilities.

Apr 3, 17:20 UTC
Update - Update : Our team will update the switch firmware to resolve the instabilities. This update will take between 10 and 15 minutes.

Apr 3, 17:19 UTC
Identified - Start Time : 03/04/2022 17:04 UTC
End Time : 03/04/2022 17:06 UTC
Root cause : Switch encountered instability.

The vRack Switch was unavailable for a few minutes. This impacted the following racks:
34A01 / 34A02 / 34A03 / 34A04 / 34A05 / 34A06 / 34A07 / 34A08 / 34A09 / 34A10 / 34A13 / 34A14 / 34A16 / 34B24 / 34B26 / 34B28.
